title: Grand Rapids Police search for suspects after 2 teens injured in separate shootings
content:
GRAND RAPIDS, MI - Grand Rapids Police are investigating a pair of shootings that took place Monday evening on the city's Southeast Side.
The two incidents are not believed to be related, according to preliminary investigation. Neither shooting has resulted in an arrest as of Tuesday morning.
Officers responded around 7 p.m. Monday, Jan. 2 to a gunshot report in the 1900 block of Collins Avenue SE. On scene, they found a 17-year-old male who had been shot multiple times.
The victim, whose injuries were initially considered life-threatening, has been upgraded to non-life threatening status, police said.
A second shooting was reported shortly after 8:45 p.m. Monday in the 1000 block of Calvin Avenue SE. Officers found a 17-year-old male who suffered non-life threatening injuries when he was shot in the side.
The second shooting suspect's vehicle was described as a dark sedan.
Attempts to track the suspects in both incidents using a K-9 were unsuccessful.
Anyone with information regarding either incident is asked to call GRPD at 616-456-3400, or Silent Observer at 616-774-2345.
